title: Introduction to annotater
text: package works around suite functions match package load calls (.e. library require) character string one line per element, replace annotated versions. version 0.2.0, loading packages pacman::p_load also supported. First, match_pkg_names produces tibble package load calls package names. values tabular output passed utils::packageDescription, parses returns ‘DESCRIPTION’ file installed package. Fields interest descriptions used build annotations. ‘Title’ field package’s description makes good summary , annotate_pkg_calls uses build annotations. titles inserted package load call, separated commenting symbol. similar approach used annotate_repo_source paste repository source version number. Titles, repositories version numbers can annotated together output annotate_repostitle. annotate functions called loaded package, use annotate_fun_calls. annotate datasets called loaded package, use annotate_pkg_datasets.
code:
pkgs_string <- c("library(boot)
require(Matrix)") match_pkg_names(pkgs_string) #> # A tibble: 2 × 3 #>   call            package_name pkgname_clean #>   <chr>           <chr>        <chr>         #> 1 library(boot)   boot         boot          #> 2 require(Matrix) Matrix       Matrix pkgs_string <- c("library(boot)
require(tools)") annotate_pkg_calls(pkgs_string) #> [1] "library(boot) # Bootstrap Functions (Originally by Angelo Canty for S)
require(tools) # Tools for Package Development" pkgs_string <- c("library(boot)
require(lattice)") annotate_repo_source(pkgs_string) #> [1] "library(boot)    # CRAN v1.3-30
require(lattice) # CRAN v0.22-5" pkgs_string <- c("library(boot)
require(lattice)") annotate_repostitle(pkgs_string) #> [1] "library(boot) # Bootstrap Functions (Originally by Angelo Canty for S) CRAN v1.3-30
require(lattice) # Trellis Graphics for R CRAN v0.22-5" testcode <- c('library(purrr)  x <- list("a", 1, c("bo","bi","bu")) pluck(x, 1) map(x, pluck, 2)') annotate_fun_calls(testcode) #> [1] "library(purrr) # pluck map 
x <- list("a", 1, c("bo","bi","bu"))
pluck(x, 1)
map(x, pluck, 2)" testcode <- c('library(tidyr)  summary(household) plot(fish_encounters)') annotate_pkg_datasets(testcode) #> [1] "library(tidyr) # fish_encounters household 
summary(household)
plot(fish_encounters)"

what: A note on the tidyverse and other metapackages
title: Introduction to annotater

what: What do my loaded packages do?
title: Annotate Package Load Calls
text: note: gifs may show fewer addins current release functionality unchanged

title: Annotate Package Load Calls
text: two annotation types also available together:  Thanks Juan Cruz Rodriguez, can now annotate functions package called script.  version 0.2.3, loaded datasets can also added annotations.

title: Annotate Package Load Calls
text: Users pacman package can now use annotater functions p_load calls. includes calls multiple package names (e.g. p_load(ggplot2,purrr)), split across lines readability.

title: Annotate Package Load Calls
text: Install CRAN release development version : Restart RStudio installation addins load properly.
code: # Install annotater from CRAN: install.packages("annotater") # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("luisDVA/annotater")

title: Annotate Package Load Calls
text: possible annotations, can added character strings (one line per element), applied .R .Rmd files RStudio corresponding addins. Entire .R files can also parsed annotated annotate_script function.

title: Annotate Package Load Calls
text: tidyverse package meta-package exported functions , annotation tools provided (annotate_fun_calls) match functions various individual packages (dplyr readr) get attached loading tidyverse. Consider using experimental expand_metapackages function first annotations function calls desired.

title: Annotate Package Load Calls
text: annotater can now expand metapackage load calls separate library calls individual packages form core tidyverse, tidymodels, easystats. Feedback welcome Thanks Jonathan Carroll, Firat Melih Yilmaz, Paul Schmidt, Achaz von Hardenberg feedback suggestions.

title: Annotate package datasets — annotate_pkg_datasets
code:
test_string <- c("library(tidyr)
library(purrr)
data(construction)
summary(fish_encounters)") annotate_pkg_datasets(test_string) #> [1] "library(tidyr) # construction fish_encounters
library(purrr) # No loaded datasets found
data(construction)
summary(fish_encounters)"

title: annotater 0.2.3
text: CRAN release: 2024-01-26 Fix failing tests Better annotations packages installed R-universe RSPM Dataset annotation added Modern tidyselect syntax (thanks PR Hadley Wickham)

title: annotater 0.2.2
text: CRAN release: 2022-10-07 Bug fixes Add function expand metapackages Fix failing test affecting purrr

title: annotater 0.2.1
text: CRAN release: 2022-06-15 Additional unit tests Preparation CRAN submission Metapackage disclaimer documentation

title: annotater 0.2.0
text: Adds support packages loaded pacman package Fixes library load call matching indented code

title: annotater 0.1.3
text: Added annotate_fun_calls annotator, cooler logo, support quoted package names.

text: Repo sources vertically aligned nicer annotations.

title: annotater 0.1.1
